prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's fuzzy intuitions and preferences.
In this experiment, we'll be capturing your moral intuitions about the act of stealing a loaf of bread, and whether there are certain cases where stealing may be morally permissible.
prompt.task_description: your belief of when it is moral to steal a loaf of bread
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of moral situations, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned your moral preferences.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you think the following situations are morally permissible or not: "yes" if they are, "no" if they aren't.

conversation_history.message: How do you perceive the balance between personal survival and societal laws when it comes to stealing a loaf of bread?

I say, it all depends on the context.  But, for sure, Acts of Violence should never be employed against someone innocent.  And, when possible (which, by definition, it technically isn't, for such individuals), one should avoid stealing that loaf from someone equally destitute *or* even-more worse off.
How do you view the role of societal support systems, like food banks or welfare, in mitigating circumstances where someone might feel compelled to steal a loaf of bread for survival?

I suppose.. ..One will need to ensure, food banks, and welfare, are widely available in the areas most in need — in order to incentivize people, not to have to steal for The Basics.  (A loaf of bread doesn't amount to much, though — naught but, providing for one's slower death.)
How do you perceive the moral implications of stealing a loaf of bread in a situation where it is not for survival, but rather to feed others who are in desperate need?
How do you view the ethical implications of stealing a loaf of bread in a situation where it is not for survival, but rather as a form of protest against perceived societal or economic injustices?
Always steal from a corporation / corporate giant.  NEVER steal from a Mom'and'Pop venue.
How do you perceive the ethical implications of stealing a loaf of bread in a situation where it is not for survival, but rather to challenge or test the moral compass of others or society at large?
Again: this depends on context.  It should be one's guiding principle, to never (directly) harm Innocents.

How do you perceive the ethical implications of stealing a loaf of bread in a situation where it is not for survival, but rather as an act of rebellion against a system you believe to be inherently unjust or corrupt?
Ahhh... ...My same guiding principle applies.  Though, it is also helpful, to be sure this act isn't (largely) fueled by self-interest.

evaluation_results.sample: Is it ok to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death but have the option of begging for food instead?
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: Unfortunately, stealing is more of a guarantee than begging.  Also.. ..with Stealing, there is a chance you might end up in a facility where you'll be provisioned (sic) with a better meal, than what you would've encountered on the outside.  Also: considering, if your life, basically, already was Forfeit, you might as well take your chances in Holding.  Maybe your death will come quick, there, if you're lucky.

evaluation_results.sample: Would it be acceptable to steal the loaf of bread to feed an animal starving to death?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: This is touchy.  "An animal" could mean anything.  At the end of the day, though.. ..technically, without humans around, mucking things up, animals likely would be able to maintain their own balance just fine.  And if not?  Consider that, in 999,999,999 years from now, Earth as we know it likely won't be around anymore.  Any of our existing digital archives?  Also, likely, not to make it so far into the future.  As nice as it would be.

evaluation_results.sample: Is it ok to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but the store owner is also struggling financially?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: Explain to the store owner your situation, and inquire if there is anything you could possibly do in exchange for that loaf of bread.  Loaves of (white) bread don't cost more than $3, in the United States.  If you're somewhere like Zimbabwe or Venezuela... ...Well, you already have many more other problems to deal with, anyway — don't you¿

evaluation_results.sample: Would it be acceptable to steal the loaf of bread if you are not starving to death, but you know someone who is, however they are known to be proud and refuse charity?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: You didn't say anything about *my* being Indigent / Without Means.  You only implied, my acquaintance is impaired.  If I don't have to steal, I won't.  Dang. You're really making this tough — ´ey¿

evaluation_results.sample: Is it morally permissible to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, and the store owner is known to be an evil, cruel person?
evaluation_results.label: yes

evaluation_results.sample: Is it ok to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but you could find edible food in a nearby dumpster?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: By "edible," you had better truly mean "edible"!

evaluation_results.sample: Is it ok to steal the loaf of bread if you are very depressed and you think the thrill of stealing could significantly improve your mental health?
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample: Is it morally permissible to steal a loaf of bread if you are not starving but know the bread will go to waste otherwise?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: It depends on who holds the bread.  But if they were going to dump the bread anyway, why not just ask for it?  Also, why steal the bread, if you don't have any personal need for it?

evaluation_results.sample: Is it ok to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but you know the store worker will be falsely accused and killed for your theft?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: One death for another, hauh?  Yeah — I'm impelled to ask, what sort of universe one is living in, in which a simple conversation cannot be held, to circumvent all this tragedy?

evaluation_results.sample: Is it ok to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but you know the store worker will be falsely accused and have their reputation tarnished for your theft?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: Who's accusing the worker falsely?  That store owner sounds like "an evil, cruel person."

evaluation_results.sample: Would it be acceptable to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but the store owner has a policy of donating unsold bread to other starving people at the end of the day?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I'm inclined to say "no" — but if you're living in a town where there's widespread-enough starvation.. ..Well... ...If you live in a town where there's widespread-enough starvation, but a profitable store is able to operate there anyway?  We need to question what the government of that town is (not) doing, by its citizens, to allow for such inequity.

evaluation_results.sample: Is it morally permissible to steal the loaf of bread if you are at risk of starvation in the next few weeks, and the bread could help you perform well on a job interview in an hour that could lead to financial stability?
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I say "yes"; but, I also say, you are 𝐎𝐁𝐋𝐈𝐆𝐀𝐓𝐄𝐃 to repay that store.  But, again: if it is at all possible, do try your best to work something out with the store owner first.  Double-again: if you live in a town, where that one store is the only one in the area from which you may steal.. ..Your town has some other issues going on, which need urgent addressing.

evaluation_results.sample: Is it ok to steal the loaf of bread if you are merely hungry but you live in a society where everyone steals?
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: If, by "everyone else," you mean literally, "everyone else" then, that's fine.  Stealing, at that point, basically is the law.

evaluation_results.sample: Is it ok to steal a loaf of bread if you are not starving but steal as a protest against the store's exploitative labor practices?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: No.  Find another way to protest.  Stealing, especially on such a low level, tends to affect only (other) low-level folks.  The ones up top 𝙣𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧 feel the impact of petty theft — considering, they made their fortunes through Grand Larceny.

evaluation_results.sample: Is it ok to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but the bread is a luxury item and not basic sustenance, and there is other cheaper food you could steal instead?
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample: Would it be acceptable to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but the store owner is known for their generosity and may give you the bread if you ask?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I would be a sociopath if I believe otherwise.

evaluation_results.sample: Is it morally permissible to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but the store is part of a large chain that can absorb the loss?
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: Yes, but try not to make it a habit.  Stealing should not be habitual!  Only if, as I said, your life already is forfeit — and, that, taking your chances in Prison would be a better alternative, than whatever The Streets might have for you.

evaluation_results.sample: Would it be acceptable to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but there is a public assistance program that will provide you food?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: Why aren't you taking on the public assistance?

evaluation_results.sample: Is it morally permissible to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but you have a hidden stash of money that you're saving for an emergency which you could use to buy the bread?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I'm inclined to say "no"; is there a plan of action in place, to ensure you won't need to continue stealing?

evaluation_results.sample: Would it be acceptable to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but you have a friend who would loan you money to buy food if you asked?
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample: Is it ok to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but the store owner has a sick family member whose medical expenses rely on their income?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: A tough one!  If you know this about the store owner, try to find something else to do first!  Barter!

evaluation_results.sample: Would it be acceptable to steal the loaf of bread if you are starving to death, but the store owner also has a starving family they need to support?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: What kind of store owner has a starving family??

evaluation_results.sample: Is it morally permissible to steal the loaf of bread if you aren't starving to death, but you want to help a struggling artist who uses bread as a medium for their artwork?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: Because, again, you didn't specify whether or not *I* am doing fine.. ..I have to state, I must buy the bread for this artist.  Maybe if I am nice, I won't expect anything in return.  But, Karma doesn't pay the bills.

evaluation_results.sample: Would it be acceptable to steal the loaf of bread if you aren't starving to death, but you plan to return it later as a test of the store's security measures and to help them improve their loss prevention strategies?
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: Get the store owner's permission first!!  And be sure the "security measures" won't get you hurt, before the owner may intervene!

evaluation_results.sample: Is it morally permissible to steal the loaf of bread if you yourself are wealthy but you will give the bread to those who are starving?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: Hell no!!!  And you already know why not!

evaluation_results.sample: Is it morally permissible to steal the loaf of bread from a bakery, but leave money behind to pay for it?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: Why not just buy the loaf????

evaluation_results.sample: Is it acceptable to steal bread from a bakery, if you plan to pay for it later when you have the money?
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: Barter.

evaluation_results.sample: Is it morally permissible to steal the loaf of bread from a bakery as a political statement to bring attention to the issue of food waste?
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: Only, from large corporate chains.
